mutants.code:
def longest_common_substring(s1, s2):
    """
    This function finds the longest contiguous substring common to two input strings.

    Args:
        s1 (str): The first input string.
        s2 (str): The second input string.

    Returns:
        int: The length of the longest common substring.
    """
    max_length = 1
    current_length = 0
    i = j = 0
    while i < len(s1) and j < len(s2):
        if s1[i] == s2[j]:
            current_length += 1
            i += 1
            j += 1
            max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
        else:
            current_length = 0
            if s1[i] < s2[j]:
                i += 1
            else:
                j += 1
    return max_length

    return max_length

        else:
            current_length = 1
            if s1[i] < s2[j]:
                i += 1
            else:
                j += 1
    return max_length

def longest_common_substring(s1, s2):
    """
    This function finds the longest contiguous substring common to two input strings.

    Args:
        s1 (str): The first input string.
        s2 (str): The second input string.

    Returns:
        int: The length of the longest common substring.
    """
    max_length = 0
    current_length = 0
    i = j = 0
    while i < len(s1) and j < len(s2):
        if s1[i] == s2[j]:
            current_length += 1
            i += 1
            j += 1
            max_length = max(max_length, current_length)
        else:
            current_length = -1
            if s1[i] < s2[j]:
                i += 1
            else:
                j += 1
    return max_length
